授業概要・カリキュラム上の位置づけ: This course is aimed at helping students develop the skills necessary for achieving a good score on the TOEFL internet-based test （IBT）. TOEFL is a standardized test that measures English ability. TOEFL test scores are frequently required when applying to enter college or university in English-speaking countries. As such, students who plan to register for this course should already have achieved an advanced level of English. The course will provide students ample practice for the TOEFL, thus allowing the students the opportunity to familiarize themselves with the test.
授業方法: This course will be conducted on an on-demand (オンデマンド) online basis. Each week, an assignment package will be uploaded, and students will be required to complete the assignment and submit it online. Students will have ample opportunity to communicate with and get feedback from the instructor through Teams.
到達目標: Students will focus on the Listening section of the TOEFL test in this course.  Students will be introduced to relevant vocabulary, content, and strategies to be able to score well on the TOEFL.
授業計画・課題に対するフィードバック: Class 1 TOEFL OverviewClass 2 Identifying the Topic & Main IdeasClass 3 （continued）Class 4 Listening for DetailsClass 5 （continued）Class 6 Determining Attitude & PurposeClass 7 （continued）Class 8 Making Inferences & PredictionsClass 9 （continued）Class 10 Categorizing InformationClass 11 （continued）Class 12 Summarizing a ProcessClass 13 （continued）Class 14 Test PracticeClass 15 Test Practice
準備学習内容・時間の目安: To prepare for this TOEFL class, students should first visit the official TOEFL website (www.ets.org/toefl/) and learn more about the test itself including what the purpose of the test is and how to prepare for the test.  Students should also plan to spend at least 30 minutes after each lesson reviewing the vocabulary, grammar, and strategies introduced in the lesson.
成績評価の方法: Students’ grades are based on the satisfactory completion of the assignments and the final test score.
テキスト: There is no textbook for this course. All reading material will be provided.
